intro: Cyphia glabra, commonly known as the smooth cyphia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Cyphia glabra is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive blooms and foliage.
